content.description:
Start on the dirty ramp, avoiding the crack to the left, climbing the face.  At the vertical part, traverse right and go around the overhanging rock to the top.  Easiest route up the face.

 If you are taking beginners out for a first TR experience, send them up this route!  Nice and easy, does not feel too vertical.  Comfortable beginner route.  Great for kids!  Cleaned pretty well.
content.protection: Almost nothing to protect this route.  All loose shale with no cracks.
content.location: Same start at Enigma.  Use the dirty ramp to the left.

content.description: Climb straight up the center of the face.  The slightly overhanging rocks at the top are the most challenging.
content.protection: None.  Not a good route for a Trad Lead.  Top Rope only!
content.location: Start at the center of The Skooch Wall.

content.description: Start at the crack to the right of the lower face.  Up the ramp to the crack to the right.  Straight up to the top.
content.protection: This route may be a lead climb in the future, with one long run-out in the middle.  Possible location for one or two bolts to make the route safe.
content.location: Start on the solid rock on the lower face, at a crack just to the right of the dirty ramp area.

content.description: Climb the obvious wide crack at the left side of the Skooch Wall.  The vertical stretch at the top is the most challenging.  Use both walls for some corner / chimney skills.
content.protection: Over-Sized crack protection, #11 Hex, #4 Camelot, #2/#3 Big Bros.  Deeper placements find more solid rock.
content.location: Start at the dirty ramp to the left, and climb up to the start of the wide crack.

content.description: Highest part of the cliff face, with prominent corner and crack to the left side.  This is the only cleaned area on the cliff face, and is easily seen from the old mining road.
